Disclosure

Important information about our business

The Kiwi Adviser Network (FSP763551) holds a licence issued by the Financial Market Authority to provide financial advice. Momentum Partners Limited (FSP757091) is authorised to provide advice under that licence.

Contact details

Phone: 021 089 40336
Email: mo@momentumpartners.co.nz
Website: www.momentumpartners.co.nz

Nature and Scope of financial advice services

Our services include:

  • Mortgage lending
  • Refixes
  • Restructures
  • Refinances
  • Investment property purchases
  • Owner occupied purchases
  • Commercial property purchases
  • Businesses loans/purchases
  • Top ups for cars, boats, landscaping etc.
  • Builds

Our services do not include:

  • Kiwisaver and fund management
  • General insurance
  • Life insurance, income protection etc.

We may refer you to the appropriate professionals for advice on theses products and will provide your information to these professionals with your consent.

Commissions and fees

In most cases, we will not charge fees for our services. This is because most of the financiers that we work with will pay an upfront commission ranging from 0.4% to 0.85% of the loan amount. Some lenders will also pay a trail or ongoing commission. This commission rate is usually between 0.10% and 0.20% of the loan amount.

In some cases, we may charge a fee for our services. This typically applies in the below scenarios:

  • Commission is not payable from the financier – generally this is the case when lending is sourced from non-bank lenders or for the below products:
    • Business lending
    • Commercial property lending
    • Property Finance
  • When your lending is repaid within a timeframe which would trigger recovery of the commission received by the Adviser.
    • Financiers will claw back upfront commissions to the Adviser when repaid within 28 months from the drawdown of the funds.
  • When funding is arranged and there is no intention of proceeding with the drawdown of funds.

We will discuss and agree on applicable fees with you before proceeding with the application.

Conflicts of interest

We are here for you and will do the best that we can for you. Although we will receive payment in most cases from the financiers, we will put your interests first when working on your financial needs.

How we manage any conflicts of interest:

To ensure our advisers prioritise our clients’ interests:

  • We follow an advice process that ensures our recommendations are made appropriately, based on clients’ goals and circumstances.
  • All our advisers undergo annual training about how to manage conflicts of interest.
  • We maintain registers of conflicts of interests and the gifts and incentives we receive. These registers are monitored regularly, and additional training is provided as required.
  • We undertake an annual independent Compliance Assurance Review.

Our duties and obligations to you

We are bound by the duties of the Financial Markets Conduct Act (431I, 431K, 431L and 431M) to:

  • Meet the standards of competence, knowledge and skill set out in the Code of Conduct
  • Give priority to the clients’ interest and
  • Exercise care, diligence and skill and
  • Meet the standards of ethical behavior, conduct, and client care set out in the Code of Conduct.

Our Internal complaints process

If you are not satisfied with any part of our service, please email mo@momentumpartners.co.nz or call 021 089 40336 so that we can try to remedy the problem. Once received, we will acknowledge the complaint within 24 hours, provide a way forward (may require further information) and aim to have a resolution within 7 days although if this is not achievable, we will let you know.

Our external complaints process

If we cannot agree on how to fix the issue, or if you decide not to use the internal complaints scheme, you can contact our external disputes resolution scheme – Financial Services Complaints Limited. This service is no cost to you.

You can contact Financial Services Complaints Limited at:

Post: PO Box 4967 - Wellington 6140

Phone number: 0800 347 257

Email address: complaints@fscl.org.nz
